      • getApiVersion

        public static int getApiVersion()
        Returns:
        The Android API version of the OS that we're currently running on.

      • isAtLeastM

        public static boolean isAtLeastM()
        Returns:
        True if the version of Android that we're running on is at least M (API level 23).

      • hasPermission

        public static boolean hasPermission(android.content.Context context,
                                    java.lang.String permission)
        Check if the app has the specified permission. If it does not, the app needs to use #requestPermission. Note that if it returns true, it cannot return false in the same process as the OS kills the process when any permission is revoked.
        Parameters:
        permission - A permission from Manifest.permission

      • hasPermissions

        public static boolean hasPermissions(android.content.Context context,
                                     java.lang.String[] permissions)
        Does the app have all the specified permissions
